title: Partizan Belgrade vs Manchester United LIVE: Stream, team news and latest updates from Europa League
text:
Follow live updates as Manchester United look for their first win in almost a month as they return to Europa League action against Partizan Belgrade.

Partizan welcome Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s to the Serbian capital with the two sides level on points at the top of Group L, and United hoping to move away at the summit and strengthen their chances of qualification for the knockout rounds.

A much-improved performance at Liverpool has given Solskjaer a little bit of breathing space with the pressure apparently mounting prior to that draw, and the Norwegian will be keen to continue to turnaround the club’s poor form at the Partizan Stadium. Follow the latest live:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Team Manchester United: Romero, Jones, Maguire (c), Rojo, Wan-Bissaka, Garner, McTominay, Williams; Mata; Lingard, Martial

Confirmed United line-up

Romero, Jones, Maguire (c), Rojo, Wan-Bissaka, Garner, McTominay, Williams; Mata; Lingard, Martial.

When is it?

Kick off at Partizan Stadium is at 5.55pm BST.

How can I watch it?

The game will be aired live on BT Sport 2, with coverage beginning at 5.30pm.

Subscribers to BT Sport can watch the game online via the BT Sport player, or on the BT Sport app.
